required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Trial of CSL's 2009 H1N1 Influenza Vaccine (CSL425) in Healthy Children
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II, Multicentre, Randomised, Observer-blind Study to Evaluate the Immunogenicity, Safety and Tolerability of CSL's 2009 H1N1 Influenza Vaccine (CSL425) in Healthy Children Aged >= 6 Months to < 9 Years.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether CSL425 is a safe and effective vaccine for eliciting an immune response to H1N1 influenza in healthy children.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Haemagglutination Inhibition (HI) Antibody Titre Seroconversion Rate After the First Vaccination
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before and 21 days after the first vaccination
primary_outcome.description: HI antibody titre seroconversion was defined as participants with a pre-vaccination titre of less than 1:10 achieving a post-vaccination HI antibody titre of 1:40 or more; or participants with a pre-vaccination HI titre of 1:10 or more achieving a four-fold or greater increase in post-vaccination HI titre.

primary_outcome.measure: HI Antibody Titre Seroconversion Rate After the Second Vaccination
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before and 21 days after the second vaccination
primary_outcome.description: HI antibody titre seroconversion was defined as participants with a pre-vaccination titre of less than 1:10 achieving a post-vaccination HI antibody titre of 1:40 or more; or participants with a pre-vaccination HI titre of 1:10 or more achieving a four-fold or greater increase in post-vaccination HI titre.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Fold Increase (GMFI) in the HI Antibody Titre After the First Vaccination
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before and 21 days after the first vaccination
primary_outcome.description: GMFI in HI antibody titre was defined as the geometric mean of the fold increase in the post-vaccination antibody titre over the pre-vaccination antibody titre.

primary_outcome.measure: GMFI in the HI Antibody Titre After the Second Vaccination
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before and 21 days after the second vaccination
primary_outcome.description: GMFI in HI antibody titre was defined as the geometric mean of the fold increase in the post-vaccination antibody titre over the pre-vaccination antibody titre.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving a HI Antibody Titre of 1:40 or More After the First Vaccination
Percentage of Participants Achieving a HI Antibody Titre of 1:40 or More After the Second Vaccination

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency and Intensity of Solicited Adverse Events (AEs) After the First or Second Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 7 days after each vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: Solicited AEs included AEs that were specifically sought for. Grade 3 solicited AE definitions: Cried when limb was moved/spontaneously painful (Cohort A) or prevented normal daily activities (Cohort B) for injection site pain; Size > 100 mm for injection site redness and induration/swelling; Temperature > 103.1째F (39.5째C) for fevers; Prevented normal daily activities or required medical intervention for all other systemic AEs.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Solicited AEs After the First Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 7 days after the first vaccination and up to Day 20 after the first vaccination if AE is ongoing at Day 7.
secondary_outcome.description: Solicited AEs included AEs that were specifically sought for.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Solicited AEs After the Second Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 7 days after the second vaccination and up to Day 20 after the second vaccination if AE was ongoing at Day 7.
secondary_outcome.description: Solicited AEs included AEs that were specifically sought for.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Adverse Events of Special Interest (AESIs), and New Onset of Chronic Illnesses (NOCIs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 180 days after the last vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: An AESI was defined as an AE for which the association with seasonal influenza vaccine was unclear. A NOCI was defined as the diagnosis of a new medical condition that was chronic in nature, including those potentially controllable by medication (eg, diabetes, asthma).

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency and Intensity of Unsolicited Adverse Events After the First or Second Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 21 days after each vaccination; up to 180 days after the last vaccination for SAEs, AESIs, and NOCIs
secondary_outcome.description: Unsolicited AEs included AEs other than those specifically sought for. Grade 1 unsolicited AE definition: Easily tolerated and did not interfere with normal daily activities. Grade 2 unsolicited AE definition: Some interference with normal daily activities. Grade 3 unsolicited AE definition: Prevented normal daily activities.

clinical_study.condition: Influenza Caused by the Novel Influenza A (H1N1) Virus

arm_group.description: 15 mcg of hemagglutinin antigen per dose. 0.25 mL intramuscular injection into the deltoid region of the arm on Day 0 and Day 21
30 mcg of hemagglutinin antigen per dose. 0.5 mL intramuscular injection into the deltoid region of the arm on Day 0 and Day 21

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female aged >= 6 months to < 9 years at the time of the first study vaccination.
- For children < 3 years of age at the time of first vaccination, born at or after 36 weeks of gestation.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known hypersensitivity to a previous dose of influenza virus vaccine or allergy to eggs, chicken protein, thiomersal, neomycin, polymyxin, or any components of the Study Vaccine.

results_reference.citation: Nolan T, McVernon J, Skeljo M, Richmond P, Wadia U, Lambert S, Nissen M, Marshall H, Booy R, Heron L, Hartel G, Lai M, Basser R, Gittleson C, Greenberg M. Immunogenicity of a monovalent 2009 influenza A(H1N1) vaccine in infants and children: a randomized trial. JAMA. 2010 Jan 6;303(1):37-46. doi: 10.1001/jama.2009.1911. Epub 2009 Dec 21.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: One randomized participant withdrew consent prior to vaccine administration and was not included in the participant flow data or in any analysis population.

group.title: CSL425 (15 mcg) Cohort A
group.description: Participants aged 6 months to less than 3 years received two doses of CSL425 (15 mcg of haemagglutinin antigen per 0.25 mL dose) by intramuscular injection into the deltoid region of the arm on Day 0 and Day 21.

group.title: CSL425 (30 mcg) Cohort A
group.description: Participants aged 6 months to less than 3 years received two doses of CSL425 (30 mcg of haemagglutinin antigen per 0.5 mL dose) by intramuscular injection into the deltoid region of the arm on Day 0 and Day 21.

group.title: CSL425 (15 mcg) Cohort B
group.description: Participants aged 3 years to less than 9 years received two doses of CSL425 (15 mcg of haemagglutinin antigen per 0.25 mL dose) by intramuscular injection into the deltoid region of the arm on Day 0 and Day 21.

group.title: CSL425 (30 mcg) Cohort B

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Haemagglutination Inhibition (HI) Antibody Titre Seroconversion Rate After the First Vaccination
outcome.description: HI antibody titre seroconversion was defined as participants with a pre-vaccination titre of less than 1:10 achieving a post-vaccination HI antibody titre of 1:40 or more; or participants with a pre-vaccination HI titre of 1:10 or more achieving a four-fold or greater increase in post-vaccination HI titre.
outcome.time_frame: Before and 21 days after the first vaccination
outcome.population: The Evaluable Population (for the first vaccination) comprised all randomised participants who received the first study vaccination; provided both pre- and post-vaccination blood samples; were not excluded from analyses (eg, for the use of a prohibited medication or a laboratory-confirmed 2009 H1N1 infection between Visit 1 and Visit 3).

outcome.title: Frequency and Intensity of Solicited Adverse Events (AEs) After the First or Second Vaccination
outcome.description: Solicited AEs included AEs that were specifically sought for. Grade 3 solicited AE definitions: Cried when limb was moved/spontaneously painful (Cohort A) or prevented normal daily activities (Cohort B) for injection site pain; Size > 100 mm for injection site redness and induration/swelling; Temperature > 103.1째F (39.5째C) for fevers; Prevented normal daily activities or required medical intervention for all other systemic AEs.
outcome.time_frame: During the 7 days after each vaccination
outcome.population: The Safety Population comprised all participants who received at least one dose of the vaccine and provided follow-up safety data.

outcome.title: Incidence of Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Adverse Events of Special Interest (AESIs), and New Onset of Chronic Illnesses (NOCIs)
outcome.description: An AESI was defined as an AE for which the association with seasonal influenza vaccine was unclear. A NOCI was defined as the diagnosis of a new medical condition that was chronic in nature, including those potentially controllable by medication (eg, diabetes, asthma).
outcome.time_frame: Up to 180 days after the last vaccination
outcome.population: The Safety Population comprised all participants who received at least one dose of the vaccine and provided follow-up safety data.

group.description: Participants aged 6 months to less than 3 years received two doses of CSL425 (15 mcg of haemagglutinin antigen per 0.25 mL dose) by intramuscular injection into the deltoid region of the arm on Day 0 and Day 21.

group.description: Participants aged 6 months to less than 3 years received two doses of CSL425 (30 mcg of haemagglutinin antigen per 0.5 mL dose) by intramuscular injection into the deltoid region of the arm on Day 0 and Day 21.

group.title: CSL425 (15 mcg) Cohort B
group.description: Participants aged 3 years to less than 9 years received two doses of CSL425 (15 mcg of haemagglutinin antigen per 0.25 mL dose) by intramuscular injection into the deltoid region of the arm on Day 0 and Day 21.

group.title: CSL425 (30 mcg) Cohort B
group.description: Participants aged 3 years to less than 9 years received two doses of CSL425 (30 mcg of haemagglutinin antigen per 0.5 mL dose) by intramuscular injection into the deltoid region of the arm on Day 0 and Day 21.

measure.title: Incidence of Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Adverse Events of Special Interest (AESIs), and New Onset of Chronic Illnesses (NOCIs)
measure.description: An AESI was defined as an AE for which the association with seasonal influenza vaccine was unclear. A NOCI was defined as the diagnosis of a new medical condition that was chronic in nature, including those potentially controllable by medication (eg, diabetes, asthma).
measure.population: The Safety Population comprised all participants who received at least one dose of the vaccine and provided follow-up safety data.

outcome.title: Frequency and Intensity of Unsolicited Adverse Events After the First or Second Vaccination
outcome.description: Unsolicited AEs included AEs other than those specifically sought for. Grade 1 unsolicited AE definition: Easily tolerated and did not interfere with normal daily activities. Grade 2 unsolicited AE definition: Some interference with normal daily activities. Grade 3 unsolicited AE definition: Prevented normal daily activities.
outcome.time_frame: During the 21 days after each vaccination; up to 180 days after the last vaccination for SAEs, AESIs, and NOCIs
outcome.population: The Safety Population comprised all participants who received at least one dose of the vaccine and provided follow-up safety data.

measure.description: Unsolicited AEs included AEs other than those specifically sought for. Grade 1 unsolicited AE definition: Easily tolerated and did not interfere with normal daily activities. Grade 2 unsolicited AE definition: Some interference with normal daily activities. Grade 3 unsolicited AE definition: Prevented normal daily activities.
measure.population: The Safety Population comprised all participants who received at least one dose of the vaccine and provided follow-up safety data.

reported_events.time_frame: For SAEs: up to 180 days after the last vaccination. For Other AEs: solicited AEs: during the 7 days after each vaccination; unsolicited AEs: during the 21 days after each vaccination; up to 180 days after the last vaccination for AESIs and NOCIs.
reported_events.desc: Unsolicited AEs presented in the organ system "General disorders" with a footnote of "MedDRA V13.0", were collected under the MedDRA System Organ Class (SOC) 'General disorders and administration site conditions'. Solicited AEs are presented in the organ system "General disorders" and were not collected under the MedDRA SOC.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: CSL agreements and restrictions on publishing may vary with individual investigators; however, CSL will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. CSL supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial and generally requires that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
